snippet: The prospect of millions of dollars in aid, aimed at reviving the fishery industry, has divided fishermen and officials in Gloucester, Mass., over the future of the area’s shoreline economy.
abstract: Prospect of millions of dollars in federal aid from Congress, aimed at reviving struggling Northeastern commercial fishery industry, has ignited debate in Gloucester, Mass; many fishermen there see money as much-needed lifeline, but city officials are hoping to spend some of it to boost to area’s shoreline economy.
lead_paragraph: The prospect of millions of dollars in aid, aimed at reviving the fishery industry, has divided fishermen and officials in Gloucester, Mass., over the future of the area’s shoreline economy.

headline.seo: Debate Over How to Help Massachusetts Fishing Towns
headline.main: As Fisheries Struggle, Debate Heats Up Over How to Help
headline.print_headline: As Fisheries Struggle, Debate Heats Up Over How to Help
